intro: Stenogyne rotundifolia var. montana, commonly known as the mountain stenogyne, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its small, oval-shaped leaves and clusters of white to pale pink flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as rainforests and rocky areas. It is known for its ornamental value and is often cultivated for its attractive foliage and delicate blooms. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
